conversations.content: I was searching for Ulthar when I first met her.
Ulthar, where are you?
There you are! Were you playing with this little guy?
Meow.
That's so sweet. I wish I had a friend to play with too.
Curran and Heinwald are nice, but they're both grown-ups...
Um... Could you please get your cat away from Mr. Mouse?
He's my friend. And I don't want him to get eaten...
Ulthar's a good boy. He wouldn't eat your friend. Isn't that right, Ulthar?
Meow.
Wow... He's resting on top of Mr. Kitty!
Still think he's scary?
Hey, that's her, isn't it? The girl from that heretic village, Hethiwood?
She can transform with forbidden magic. First, she'll rip into you with her claws, and then she'll bite your head off!
No I won't...
Like we'd believe anything a heretic has to say. Go away, weirdo!
...I guess you can't help but be scared. Even if I don't do anything, something could still happen...
I should go. Come on, Ulthar.
Wait! I'm... I'm sorry I didn't trust your kitty.
Why don't we go play together? We can bring our animal friends too!
You...want to play with me? Why?
'Cause I wanna be friends. ...If that's okay, I mean.
Yeah. I'd like that.
From that day on, we were playmates. Pia's a bit of a crybaby, but she also has the kindest heart.
Talk about puttin' on the ritz, little miss! You gonna be okay without me at that summer festival in the courtyard today?
Yeah. Pia's coming with me.
Oh, the little girl from the Harmonia Choir? I'm so glad you made a friend your own age. Keep her close, okay, Lathna?
Life might sometimes feel like a wild ride that you've gotta grit your teeth and bear alone. But with good friends at your side, you can overcome any and all obstagoals!
(He messed up his words again...)
Sorry to keep you waiting, Lathna. You ready?
Ready.
Time to put a little life into the Halidom! We're gonna beat the heat AND the fatigue right outta these people!
We've got stands. We've got shows. We'll even be launching pyroblossoms! Truly, we've got it all.
This cotton candy's so yummy!
Uh-huh. By the way, I'm surprised you wore a yukata too.
Althemia made it for me. What do you think?
It looks...really cute.
Hee hee. I think your yukata looks super pretty too.
Oh, I just remembered. Althemia gave me a scrunchie. I have one just like it, so I'll let you have the other.
Thank you...
Hee hee! Now we match! Let's put our hair up the same way too.
Okay.
Hm? What's going on? There are a lot of people over there.
Then the old man at the stall slowly turned and said... ＂Did its face look something like THIS?!＂
Hi, Elias. What's happening over here?
They're having a scary story contest. It's a Hinomotoan summer tradition, apparently. We figured we'd give it a whirl too.
Oh. That sounds...um...
Don't worry! Celliera's too chipper to make it super scary.
So my stories aren't scary enough... I have failed you all. FAILED, I say!
Then perhaps I will step in and tell some frightful fancies of my own.
Oh no...
From idle reverie to blackest nightmare, the world of sleep is home to a multitude. Yet I would tell you about the strangest phenomenon of them all: the Dreamlands.
I've never heard of that...
The dream starts near a descending staircase, its stairs numbering a multiple of seven. At the bottom, you find yourself in a red cavern.
There are two priests. Once you have greeted them, a vast, shimmering wood unfolds before your very eyes. This is the world of oddities: the Dreamlands.
Lurking in its midst are blood-red rats that gnaw through bone, and hideous, cannibalistic ghouls. Every creature is more terrifying than the last...
But it's all a dream, right? So there's nothing to be scared of.
And yet some say our souls leave our bodies as we sleep, and dreams are what they see. So what if the Dreamlands are actually part of another world?
If your soul were to be captured by its inhabitants...you would never wake again.
Nooo! I don't wanna end up in the Dreamlands! What do I do?
Don't worry, Pia. You'll be all right.
Dear me. It seems I've unsettled some listeners. Perhaps a nice spell is in order.
Y' ephaichase ymg' orr'e.
There. Now you shouldn't have any nightmares.
Thank you, Akasha.
Oh, I just heard a pyroblossom... Do you want to go see them, Pia?
Yeah.
They're so pretty!
Yeah. I love how they sparkle... —Like the glimmering stars I once glimpsed in the blackest expanse...
Hey, Lathna? Would you mind coming with me real quick?
Of course. Where to?
Um... To the bathroom...
Thanks for waiting.
Let's go back to the festival. The entrance should be over here.
...Huh? This doesn't look like the fairgrounds.
That's strange. I thought this was where we came in.
Let's go back the way we came. Okay, Pia? ...Pia?
Pia, where are you? If this is you playing hide-and-seek, it's not funny.
Huh? What's a staircase doing here? And there's something fallen next to it...
It's Pia's sandal!
I descended the staircase in search of my friend.  Down, down, and down further still...
How far down does this staircase go? It's so dark...and scary.
The dream starts near a descending staircase, its stairs numbering a multiple of seven. At the bottom, you find yourself in a red cavern.
...No. This isn't a dream. So I can't stop now.
Not when Pia might be down here.
Fire... It's a red cavern! And is that—?!
Pia! Are you okay? Stay with me!
Huh...? Lathna... Weren't we just in the castle?
I remember we were looking for the entrance when someone pushed me, and—EEK!
What's wrong?
Behind you!
Who are you?!
So we have two dreamers. No—one is the overseer, only half asleep.
To think they would enter in the same way humans do... Is this a game? Or one of their tricks?
What are you talking about?
If this dreamer is guided by the overseer, we should let them both pass.
Then let us hurry to send them through the gate. Delaying any longer would be most onerous indeed.
Aaaaaugh!
We fell. The void was blacker than night. We were swept away, not knowing which way was up. And then...
Lathna... Lathna!
Pia... Is this the Mistholt?
No. I don't know where this is. The mushrooms are all glowy, and it's super creepy.
Hey, Lathna? Do you...remember what Akasha said in her story?
There are two priests. Once you have greeted them, a vast, shimmering wood unfolds before your very eyes. This is the world of oddities: the Dreamlands.
You think that's where we are?
Yeah... We might have wandered into a dream without even realizing it.
What if we get caught by a monster and never wake up again? I... I... *sob*
But we were awake this whole time. How could we have fallen asleep without realizing it?
Offer yourself unto the Ancient One.
MEOOOOOOW!
It can't be...
Eeek! There's something moving in the grass!
Chchch...chchchch... Chchch...
It sounds like an animal. A mouse, maybe?
I've never heard a mouse that sounds like that.
Chchch...chchchch... Chchch...
Crimson fur... Wait. Are these the ＂blood-red rats＂?
Chch... Chchch...
There're more of them!
Chch... chkich... Zkh... Chch.
Wh-what's going on? Are they...talking to each other?
＂Those girls look like dreamers. They don't know what we're saying.＂
＂Let's get a nibble of their ears for some meat. Then we can soak their bones in the murky waters of the moon-tree.＂
You understand what they're saying, Lathna?
Chchch... Chch! Rrraaah!
They're coming for us! We've gotta run!
Chchch! Chchchch!
(There're so many of them! I can't run fast enough because of my sandals... What do we do?!)
Eep!
Lathna!
I can't run anymore... You have to go on without me, Pia!
You can get away while the rats are focused on me! Hurry!
No! I'm not gonna leave you alone, Lathna!
Chchchchchch!
Meeeow.
They're...not attacking. Oh!
Are those kitties here to protect us?
Is that black cat at the front...Ulthar?
No... It's not. But I feel like I've seen him before.
Meow. Meeeow.
Are you trying to tell us to run while we have the chance?
Meow.
Thank you, little kitty...
Do you think we're safe here?
Hey, Pia? If I trip like that again... I want you to focus on getting away.
I don't want you to put yourself in danger because of me.
No. I'm not running! You're my friend, and you mean too much to me!
We're gonna be together forever. So let's just do our best to get back to the castle, okay?
...Okay.
Oh, hey! There's someone over there. Maybe they can help us!
Excuse me! Er... Hello?
*chomp* *slurp* *munch* *snap* *smack*
(Is he...eating meat? Whatever it is, it smells awful...)
*crunch* *gulp* Mmmmmm?
EEEK!
Mm... Mmmm... Mmm... Mmmm...
What's wrong with this person? He smells awful!
No... Stay away from me!
Mmm... Mmmmm! Rrraaagh!
Those children are ALIVE. You cannot eat them YET.
Mm?! Mmzhmmya! Zzh! Myugasha!
If you're still HUNGRY, then go raid a gug's GRAVE. Otherwise...
Looks like he's given up on you TWO. Are you girls OKAY?
Who are you...?
I'm Richard the GHOUL.
You mean the monster Akasha told us about?! You're not gonna eat us, are you?!
No, NO. We only eat the DEAD. It's very rare to see one stray and attack the LIVING.
More importantly, it seems you two are LOST. I can tell, because we were the SAME.
What do you mean?
My whole squad accidentally wandered into this WORLD. After living here for so long, we eventually became GHOULS.
We look human now, but before long, we'll probably start looking more like DOGS. HeeHEEheeHEEhee!
So if we get stuck here, we're gonna turn into monsters too?!
Not NECESSARILY. But I do know it's not good for kids to be in this WORLD. How about I take you back to your OWN?
You mean you know how to get back?
We ghouls like to steal corpses from the waking world as WELL, so we know a secret way to get in and out of HERE.
Oh, you don't need to be suspicious of ME. I'm doing this out of the kindness of my HEART. I'm just so glad to talk to another person after so LONG.
What do you wanna do, Lathna?
...I think we can trust him.
We followed Richard. Though he looked scary, he was cheerful and kind to us.
He informed us that we had indeed wandered into the Dreamlands.
In this WORLD, cats are WARRIORS. They're intelligent and fiercely LOYAL.
The cat that rescued you two might have been one you took care of at some POINT.
That black kitty... It might have been the one who befriended me back in Kyril.
Those rats are pretty troublesome, but it's possible to communicate with them if you know their LANGUAGE. That makes them one of the less awful denizens HERE.
For instance, there are invisible caterpillars that lurk in the ravine up AHEAD. They devour anything unlucky enough to fall into their DOMAIN.
That's so scary...
But more terrifying still are those who guard the Great ONES.
Who are they...?
In the epic poem GRASTAEA, as well as the Tome of CREATION, there are countless tales of these abnormal beings known as the Great ONES.
Guarding them is a ruler and an OVERSEER. Though they work together in this SENSE, they are also in direct opposition with each OTHER.
If you were to get mixed up in their BATTLE, it would be OVER. It is told that those who do go mad with FEAR and lose all sense of SELF.
What do we do if we ever run into them?
Good QUESTION... I would say you'd need an emotional pillar of strength to maintain your SANITY.
If you have happy memories you can turn TO, you should be able to stay sane no matter what terror you may FACE.
Happy memories...
Eeek! S-something's coming down from the sky!
Oh, no need to WORRY. That is a simple NIGHTGAUNT.
It doesn't have a face...
It only looks SCARY. They won't hurt you as long as you stay out of their TERRITORY.
EEEK! Then why is it grabbing me?!
AAAAAAHHHHH!
Pia! PIA!
Is this one of its friends?! Aaaah!
Why would a nightgaunt go after someone outside of its TERRITORY? No... Could it be HIM?!
Let go of me! LET GO OF ME!
(Where is this thing trying to take me?)
The ground's getting closer and closer...!
Ack!
It dropped me. Where...am I?
What's that? Oh... A deer. You really scared me, you kno—
EEEEE! EEEEE! EEEEEEEEEEEE!!!
The ground swallowed it! No, that's not it... There's something IN the ground here!
It's trying to pull me in too! AAAAAHHHHH!
Ngh... Where did that monster take me?
It looks like a big mansion, but it's so creepy... *sob* I'm so scared... Eek!
I tripped... I've gotta get all my things back in my pouch... *sob* *hic*
Oh. This is the matching scrunchie for the one I gave Lathna...
Come on, Pia. You're not the only one who's scared right now. Lathna must be just as terrified.
If she saw me like this, it'd only make her feel worse.
So this is the dreamer the overseer brought.
Who are you?
I am told the humans have named me... the Lord of the Great Abyss.
Um... Are you the one who sent those monsters to bring me here?
Indeed. The nightgaunts are my servants.
What happened to my friend, Lathna?
Your ＂friend＂? Ha ha ha... HA HA HA HA!
Eek...!
Now this is most amusing. I never thought I'd see the day when someone would call him ＂friend＂!
I had the nightgaunts drop him into the Demon's Pit. I imagine the caterpillars have long since dragged him into the ground and begun their fetid feast.
Lathna's been eaten?! No! It can't be!
I suspect my longstanding foe is far too resilient to die such an inglorious death.
O turgid maggots, with your pitiful lust for flesh. For the witless sin of swallowing We of a thousand forms, We devour you from within.
We are the key. The Emissary of the Ancient One. The scent of entrails is a most disagreeable gambol. We shall retaliate for this plot hidden in the abyss.
What do you mean, Lathna's your enemy?
He and I are of the same belief in the matter of protecting the Great Ones.
But he is an agent of the Outer Gods. He longs for chaos above all—exists only to instill madness in all that is.
In other words, his very existence is a thorn in my side. Thus, I thought to use you to humiliate him.
What do I have to do with any of this?
Until this moment, he has never invited a dreamer into this world. It seems he has quite the attachment to you.
I want nothing more than to see him rage over having his favorite toy stolen away.
I don't understand most of what you're saying...
But Lathna is just a normal girl! The same as me.
So please don't hurt her. She's too important to me!
So this is what you humans call ＂friendship.＂ What say YOU, hm?
Let me hear your answer, N Y A R L A T H O T E P.
We are the crawling chaos. We are the shadow that writhes in the darkness. We are the Other who stands at your back.
Lathna! When did you get here?!
(What's going on with her? She seems...different.)
Lord of the Great Abyss. He who invites Us to such wicked festivities. A rancid effluvium hangs ever about you.
I saw fit to greet you with matching dignity. The rotting stench of the caterpillars is a most fitting shroud for you and your blackened entrails.
Though we oppose one another, we are guardians who must cooperate all the same. By what foolish scheme do you violate our accord?
I ought to ask you the same thing. It seems you have been visiting the Dreamlands often of late. What are you plotting?
We are the Black and White. The Criminal and the Innocent. It has been centuries since We last crossed the threshold into these lands.
So you claim ignorance. Or perhaps... No, it is of no matter. Instead, I must ask you.
What thoughts did you have when that girl was taken from you? What emotions did you harbor that brought you here?
Your desire will not be granted. We came only to depose a despot. Humans are sacrificial pawns. We take no interest in them.
Oh, so you would attack me like a common dog? How unlike you to forego strategy.
Allow me to postulate. The will that brought you here was not your own, Nyarlathotep.
One of you...the girl named Lathna...spoke to the depths of your consciousness and begged you to save her friend.
You extol chaos with your thousand forms. Yet I believe these selves, each with their own identity, are fraying the fabric of your tenuous integrity.
With every face is born more connections, each creating something new you must protect. I simply cannot wait to see you at their mercy—a thrall to your sentiments!
You weave baseless assumptions. We shall not entertain this puerile line of questioning any longer.
Oh, have I hit a nerve? What bliss! How I love to hear you suffer!
This alone makes tonight a most fruitful harvest. I shan't play any longer.
Guardians of the Great Ones we may be, yet We would abstain from your company. Begone and remain in the depths of the abyss forevermore, away from Us always.
You... You ARE Lathna, aren't you?
Are you here to save me?
...Humans are sacrificial pawns. We take no interest in them.
Our ambition shall not be shackled by an inferior existence. If you think to hinder Us, then We shall send you to your grave.
Huh? Lathn—nnngh! Hnk... Aaah...!
Lathna...! I-I can't breathe...!
Offering. Oblation. We ask you before you sink into oblivion. Why did you come to this land of dreams?
Lathna, please... Look... It's our scrunchie...!
Hee hee! Now we match! Let's put our hair up the same way too.
Okay.
Remember our...happy memories! Please...come back...
We are Chaos. Messenger of the One. You, a fool who wallows in mud. We are... We...are...
...Huh? What was I—?
Pia? No...! NO! Did I do this?!
No... NO! NOOOOO!!!
Looks like I made it just in time.
Where...am I? Is this my room?
Rise and shine, Lathna. It's time for breakfast.
Curran... Why am I here?
You still sawin' logs over there, kiddo?
You left in the middle of the festival, came back here, and went straight to bed. Sleeping in your yukata like that isn't very ladylike, you know.
(Was that all just a dream?)
*gasp* Where's Pia?!
She's probably already sittin' down to eat. Well? Don't keep the girl waiting. Get dressed and head straight on over.
Pia!
Lathna...
(Oh, thank goodness! She's okay!)
Hey, Pia, I—
What are you doing, Pia? C'mon, let's sit down.
Okay...
Pia...?
Hi, Pia. Do you wanna come play?
Sorry, Lathna. I have to go to rehearsal...
Hey, Ulthar... Was that really just a dream?
Pia? No...! NO! Did I do this?!
No... NO! NOOOOO!!!
Akasha said that dreams are what your soul sees when it exits your body.
If that really was another world... Then I did something horrible to Pia.
What's the matter, sour grapes? Keep making that face and it'll stick that way.
Curran...
All by yourself again, huh? I haven't seen Pia around lately.
Curran... I... I...
So you think your soul went to another world called the Dreamlands, and while you were there, you attacked Pia.
I just know Pia hates me now because of what happened there. She has to.
You weren't the one who attacked her. The thing lying dormant within you did. Besides, it really might have been just a dream.
But it felt so real.
All right. Let's assume that it WAS real. What are you going to do about it?
...I just won't go near Pia anymore. That'd be for the best.
It's great how conscientious you are. But is that really what you want?
I can play by myself. And I know I have you and Ulthar...
But... But I really want...to be friends with Pia.
I wanna be with her forever! And if I did something awful to her, I wanna say I'm sorry!
Okey-doke, little miss. If that's what you want, I'll give you a helping hand.
Curran...
Three days later, Curran told me to change into my yukata and come to the courtyard in the evening.
What are we going to do now, Curran?
You two weren't able to enjoy the festival all the way through, right? So now, you're gonna get a do-over.
Er, just without the food carts and stuff. But I've got these for you instead!
What are these...tube-looking things?
They're handheld pyroblossoms Su Fang made. Apparently, they bloom just as beautifully as the big boys they set off at a regular show.
I've called Pia over. Once she gets here, you two can play with these and have a nice, long chat.
We humans make each other happy by sharing our experiences. Sharing a sentimental moment is especially likely to make someone forget the bad times.
Think of that pyroblossom as a beacon of hope—a burst of passionate flame that'll shine some light on the special friendship you two share.
And then things will be okay...? Even after what I did?
You didn't hurt her, Lathna. It really was just a dream, I promise.
How can you be so sure?
I did a little research, but I think it's best if we let our expert here explain it.
My deepest apologies. The spell I used is the reason why you dreamt about the Dreamlands.
Oh... Do you mean the one you said would keep away nightmares?
I am ashamed to say, but I accidentally used the wrong spell. Catastrophically so.
The spell I used instead was one that calls forth the fears within someone and forces them to have nightmares.
So this freaky-deaky magic combined with the scary story Akasha told you earlier is the whole reason you dreamt all that.
Then it really WAS just my fears showing up in a dream.
But that doesn't explain why Pia won't play with me anymore.
That's somethin' you've gotta ask her. But there's one thing we can say for sure.
You two CAN be great friends. From now until forever.
After a little while, Pia came out to the courtyard dressed in her yukata. Though things were still awkward between us, we lit the handheld fireworks.
The sparkling flames were as beautiful as stars glimmering in the darkest night sky...
My firework's all burnt out.
Mine too. All that's left are these scented pyroblossoms...
Then let's play with those. If that's okay.
Sure...
Hey, Lathna? I have something to tell you.
I knew that you were called a heretic before you came here.
Does that mean...you knew before we even met?
Yes. But I knew the moment I talked to you that you weren't bad!
With the way you treated your cat and my mouse, it was obvious how nice you are. But even still, I...
I had a horrible dream. One where you...attacked me.
I knew you were a good person...but that made me think that maybe deep down, I was actually still afraid of you.
I was so angry at myself over it, I started avoiding you. I'm so, so sorry, Lathna!
Don't cry, Pia! Besides, I... I...
Sometimes I turn into something that isn't me... So that dream you had might really happen!
Do you want to hurt me right now?
NO! Of course not!
Then you're just as good as I thought you were. I want to keep being your friend.
Me too... I want to be your friend too. Forever and ever! Is...that okay with you?
Yeah! We're gonna be together even when we're both old ladies!
Thank you, Pia!
Oh, Master Heinwald. What brings you here?
I heard what happened from Curran, and have been mulling over the information we've gathered through this incident.
What do you make of it all?
That spell you say you cast by accident was not a means of giving someone nightmares. It was a tracking spell that locates the soul of its target.
I believe you told little Lathna of the Dreamlands to awaken the overseer of those lands who sleeps within her.
You think I used that to tie a leash around Lathna and observe her? Whyever would I do a thing like that?
You were after the Great Ones who lie hidden there. Ancient gods are more than enough to pique your interest.
It is an honor to see how well you know me, Master Heinwald.
I myself am none too thrilled by our intimate acquaintance. Now, regarding your scheme...Nyarlathotep proved an effective guide into the dream world.
But there was something that you hadn't predicted, wasn't there?
Indeed. I did not think it possible to enter the Dreamlands while awake. Nor that the Faceless One would bring little Pia along.
...Huh? This doesn't look like the fairgrounds.
That's strange. I thought this was where we came in.
What's a staircase doing out here? And—EEK!
Let's go back the way we came. Okay, Pia? ...Pia?
I haven't the faintest idea what Nyarlathotep hoped to do by bringing the little girl along.
Perhaps the Nyarlathotep we know was just as surprised as we are.
What do you mean?
Nyarlathotep has a thousand forms. Now, that may only mean the utilization of multiple physical appearances...
But it could also mean a multitude of personalities and consciousnesses.
And bear in mind, a single vessel might contain more than one.
You don't mean that Lathna has someone within her that even we are not aware of!
It is only a hypothesis as of now. But if this being really is within Lathna...
...Then they may already be aware that they are Nyarlathotep.
I got to play with Pia today. I'm so glad that we're getting along again. I thank the Outer Gods for giving me such a dear friend.
Oh, but what fun I had. I enjoyed seeing the bewilderment that form took as the Lord of the Abyss dug at its weaknesses. I'm so glad I brought Pia with me.
I ought to ask you the same thing. It seems you have been visiting the Dreamlands often of late. What are you plotting?
We are the Black and White. The Criminal and the Innocent. It has been centuries since We last crossed the threshold into these lands.
It was not We, nor she who crossed into the Dreamlands. It was I. But alas, my plan with the rats was laid bare. What a pity.
Even so, I found something wonderful all the same. And though I can't come out very often...
I will take everything—everything!—and make it one. Until then, I hope you will wait for me...  M Y  D E A R  F R I E N D.
